content: jacob s ladder ear warmer perfect for the colder months this quick stash-busting project can be made in any dk weight yarn it has a two row repeat and uses treble and double crochets chains and slip stitches which makes it a great beginner project which creates a cable look stitch this pattern is written in uk terms i used hayfield spirit in melody and a 4mm hook double_crochet uk double_crochet treble_crochet uk treble_crochet foundation chain 16 double_crochet into the 2nd chain from the hook 15 double_crochet in total row 1 of pattern chain 2 and treble_crochet into the same stitch the chain 2 never counts as a stitch treble_crochet into the next 2 stitches treble_crochet into the 4th stitch and then chain 10 slip_stitch into the front loop of the 4th treble_crochet to create a loop please see picture to show where front loop is on your treble_crochet stitch treble_crochet into the next 7 stitches treble_crochet into the next stitch chain 10 create a loop by slip stitching the chains into the front v of the treble_crochet treble_crochet into the last 3 stitches chain 1 and turn you will have 3 treble_crochet then a treble_crochet with a loop then 7 treble_crochet then a treble_crochet with a loop and the final 3 treble_crochet you should have 15 treble_crochet and 2 loops row 2 of pattern double_crochet into all of the 15 stitches make sure your loops stay on the right side of the work the loops will look like they are between two stitches make sure you don t double_crochet into a loop row 3 chain 2 and treble_crochet into the first 3 stitches treble_crochet into the 4th and chain 10 slip_stitch into the front loop of that treble_crochet treble_crochet into the next 7 stitches treble_crochet into the 8th and chain 10 slip_stitch into the front loop of that treble_crochet treble_crochet into the last 3 stitches chain 1 and turn row 4 double_crochet into all of the 15 stitches repeat row 1 and 2 which set up the pattern until you reach 19 inches or the length that fits comfortably around your head finish on a row 1 first you need to connect all the loops into the pattern take the second loop and put it through the first loop and pull tight this will pull the first loop flat take the third loop and put it through the second loop and pull flat keep going until all the loops are connected on both sides you will end up with two row of joined loops that create a cable pattern finishing row when you have connected all the loops you can secure them chain 1 and double_crochet in the first 3 stitches double_crochet in the 4th and catch the last loop in the double_crochet this will secure the final loop double_crochet in the next 7 stitches double_crochet in the 8th and catch the last loop double_crochet in the last 3 stitches put the two short edges together and sew up
